definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: The boy took one sip of the wine and spat it out.
sentences.chinese: 孩子吃掉了药丸外面的糖衣，却把药心吐了出来。

sentences.english: You have to wash the pill down with sips of water.
sentences.chinese: 你得喝几口水，把药丸吞下去。

sentences.english: Prices are the same as, or lower than, loose pills, and treatment is easier to finance.
sentences.chinese: 价格与散装药丸持平或者略低，治疗费用较易承受。

sentences.english: The company also markets different Pueraria products, including pills and tea.
sentences.chinese: 该公司也将销售不同的野葛根，包括药丸和茶。

sentences.english: My father puts the first pill on his tongue.
sentences.chinese: 我爸爸把先要吃的药丸放在舌头上。

sentences.english: An interesting pill packaging concept designed by Moon Sun-Hee.
sentences.chinese: 一个有趣的药丸包装概念设计。

sentences.english: That pill you want to take to quell your nausea?
sentences.chinese: 你想让那些药丸来减轻你的恶心？

sentences.english: Don’t try to find a magic pill to solve your weight problems.
sentences.chinese: 不要试图找到一粒神奇的药丸来解决你的体重问题。

sentences.english: The TV station built up the drug pill to such a degree that it seems to have magical effects.
sentences.chinese: 这家电视台如此吹捧这种药丸，似乎它真有神效似的。

sentences.english: Description A bottle cap which pill could attach in it.
sentences.chinese: 一款瓶盖，药丸可以附于其中。

sentences.english: She took it, and looked attentively on the count;
sentences.chinese: 瓦朗蒂娜拿了那粒药丸，神情专注地望着伯爵。

sentences.english: It all starts with one pill, afterwards Tramadol is consumed in large quantities.
sentences.chinese: 开始是一粒药丸，后来就是大量地使用。

sentences.english: I need the pills to finish the story. Understand?
sentences.chinese: 我需要那药丸，才能继续说故事，懂吗？

sentences.english: These pellets, diluted with water, will form all that is necessary to support life.
sentences.chinese: 药丸经水稀释后即成为维持生命所需的全部养料。

sentences.english: He took some soluble tablets first to keep himself warm.
sentences.chinese: 首先他吃了些可溶性的药丸来使自己暖和些。

definition: medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
Yaksu in North Korea, near the border with Liaoning and Jiling province
